user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_Lock_Impl:
```c
void OS_BSP_Lock_Impl(void)
{
    int status;

    status = pthread_mutex_lock(&OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.AccessMutex);
    if (status < 0)
    {
        BSP_DEBUG("pthread_mutex_lock: %s\n", strerror(status));
    }
    else
    {
        /*
         * Temporarily Disable/Defer thread cancellation.
         * Note that OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl() calls write() which is a cancellation point.
         * So if this calling task is canceled, it risks leaving the BSP locked.
         */
        pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_DISABLE, &OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.AccessCancelState);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BSP_Lock_Impl:
#define BSP_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobalData_t OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other parts of the function do not need investigation for unreachable-code under MISRA Rule 2.1: the declaration of 'int status;' and the call assigning it (status = pthread_mutex_lock(...);) are normal reachable code. The comment block contains no executable statements. The BSP_DEBUG macro definition shown in the additional code expands to nothing; that macro definition itself is not unreachable code (it simply removes the debug call at preprocessing). The global data symbol references (OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal, its members) are ordinary references and not intrinsically unreachable. Therefore the only code constructs warranting investigation are the listed fragments.
